text:
I have a email template and a rich text module in it.
This module contains placeholder text, and when my API exports an email and its content, it is pulling both the placeholder text and the actual content that has replaced it for that specific email. As you can imagine, this causes confusion since it retrieves two different types of content.
Is there a way to check how long has the placeholder text been there?
How can I identify if there were any other placeholder text before this one?

I want to understand if there is a way to view history for this module in the backend to understand how long this text has been present.
This way, our analytics team can set rules to exclude the current placeholder text and any historic ones used for this template

anyone ever solve this problem?
conditions:
1. Two separate modules, chosen arbitrarily via DnD in the CMS.
2. Each module has its own background color -- here, module 2's background is WHITE, not transparent. or it might be a different shade of blue, gray, etc.
3. There's an ambient "wave" image on top of the background color of each module, but under the content of each module.
4. There are several wave images to choose from, also they each switch responsively (mobile and desktop versions).
5. I don't want to build a section for each set of arbitrarily-chosen modules; this could be applied to dozens of combinations.
You could create a module to manage your wave. You put your wave module between section in absolute position within a relative section it should do the trick with some z-index
